https://jenkins.openbmc.org/job/ci-repository/53660/ : SUCCESS
May not be required if inside VpdTool Class. As it will adhere to OO too. Any reason for it be outside Class?

getKwFromHw() api is a static function and not a class member. so its no where related to the class.
and I made fruPath as a parameter here intentionally to make use of this api getKwFromHw() in fixSystemVPD() api (at line 615).
Okay, your choice though but my question was why there's need for static function?

why static function -> since there is a need to use this api within this file only. and not required to be a class member.

this change is not required any more, as the design has been changed to read all vpd keywords at once from vpd map. so will revert it back.
Can we have implementation elsewhere in cpp file?
compiler throws errors if we have templated function in cpp file. please refer this https://isocpp.org/wiki/faq/templates#templates-defn-vs-decl
Not that what I meant was to templates in one file than here, either utils or local if you are implementing it again
I added a template API in utils in this commit https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/55363

We already have a function to readBusProperty in ibm_vpd_utils.cpp.
vpd tool is already including that file in its compilation.

Why not make that api templated, instead of defining a new function?

if I templatise the one in ibm_vpd_utils.cpp now, I need to change the code in many places in ibm_vpd_app.cpp and in vpd-manager. And that needs testing on almost all cases of VPD functionality. So had one separately for vpd-tool.

Well, that does not make sense at least to me.
IMO, in order to reduce our effort we should not be pushing duplicate code.
Alpana has a commit that templatizes the existing function, please re-use that and rebase this change over her commit.

Since Alpana's commit needs complete rework, for time being, I'll add a new commit that just has a templated API to read from dbus(with no modification in existing VPD code to use my templated API).

If Alpana revises her commit, I can rebase on her's. Else I can create another new commit, where I'll modify the existing VPD code to use my templated API.
<Alpana's commit - https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/openpower-vpd-parser/+/52336 >

This needs far more explanation. Please describe why are we doing it and how does it help the user.

I would also trim down the Tested section, it is unnecessarily long and unreadable anyway.
This does not read well - How about: "Use this option to interactively fix critical system VPD keywords"?

This is kind of inefficient - You are reading HW for every single keyword repeatedly - Which is why it is so slow to print the table.

Please look into doing this just once (outside the outer for loop) and then caching all the necessary rec/kw pairs.
These magic numbers are hard to follow - Please define an enumeration.
I would ask that you use a loop with a counter and retry the last count instead of a goto.
Please do this with an infinite loop and continue instead of a goto

using namespace std is already defined at the top.
At-least get rid of one of them.
Same with this. This s also defined at the top.
You can get rid of these as it has already been declared at the top.

Why are you extracting it here when you are using at line 714. 
get the value where needed. It makes code difficult to read.
These kind of naming makes code difficult to read. Please give meaningful names.
Do we need to continue further if "frus" is missing in JSON?
This still needs to be handled, so does Sunny's comment below.
To reduce repeated D-Bus calls, you could also consider calling getAll properties to just read everything in one shot. Could you give that a try to see if it helps performance any?

On an average of 13.5ms when we use GetAll() 4 times ( for 4 records )
and 5.5 ms when we use Get() 11 times (for 11 keywords).

sorry. I've updated the data vice versa. It's 5.5ms for 4 dbus calls & 13.5ms for 11 dbus calls.
making 4 dbus calls is an optimised solution than having 11 dbus calls.
The code from hereon is better moved to a separate function for readability and review
Haven't we parsed the JSON already at the beginning of the function? Why is it repeated here?
I don't understand why we need this retry complexity? Let the user continue for ever or skip manually.

I am confused here. IMO this is the process where PE's are updating the kwds, then how this automate the process of keyword data updation?
I think this needs to be rephrased.
If the code exits from here, free parser will never be called. If it is required to be called then it should be called in this flow as well.

This is similar to propertyMap defined in types.hpp.
Just a suggestion, if we use these types the code will be more readable.
PropertyMap in types.hpp supports variant<multiple types>, which is not required in this case as of now. Leaving it as it is
Will this hold good if there is a Dbus call failure to GetAll and empty is returned from the api?

yes will not have any issues.
if there is a dbus call failure and empty map is returned then 'recData' will be empty and this for loop (at line 738) will not get executed.
Please define this as something readable in types.hpp.
this is required only in vpd-tool. so will have it here itself.
This is not a change you have made, but could you look into remove this? Not a good idea to do using namespace .. in a header file.
Removing line 11 is affecting many other files like editorimpl.cpp and test case source files. So I'll handle this in a separate commit.
I'd prefer we do it with this changeset - a separate commit is fine, but I would like to get this in.
Please use a std:: prefix here - and remove the using namespace std at the top of this file.
These could be a single line, with auto
This will crash if the svpdBusData map does not have the record we are looking for. Please check if find succeeded.

that will never happen as I query and emplace (line 686-708) only those records mentioned in svpdKwdMap.
still will have the check as this api can get modified in future.
Typo - could you run this new code through a spell-checker since it has a lot of couts that are directly visible to the user.
We agreed to handle the comment about the std namespace in a separate commit.
Can it be like fixSystemVPDKw, as it may confuse with whole VPD.
the description about the flag helps user in understanding its usage. so let's keep it unmodified.
Here too it gives impression of fixing whole VPD.
that shouldn't matter as they are code internals. and again doxygen about the api gives the explanation.
